website_summaries.verdict: With tungsten-tipped heads and 4 blades, owners report excellent results.
pros: Boasts 4 different blades (set at angles), a 230-volt motor, and 28,000 cuts per minute
cons: Jointer is extremely heavy (500 pounds), which means it must be permanently sited

customer_reviews.title: Great Jointer, but dust pickup?
customer_reviews.text: This Powermatic replaces my jointer of the same size and performs as expected. Beds were spot-on upon arrival, no adjustment needed. Fence mounts needed help, but a minor issue. Once set up, it squares the work perfectly and the fence returns to square with no fuss. Dust pickup: The reviews on this are a flat out lie. Chips stream out from under the in feed table, ignoring my 3 HP cyclone system that has always and continues to support 4 other machines admirably, including my previous jointer. 3 calls to Powermatic tech support indicates this is a known issue with no solution other than "more CFM". This remains a pleasure to use, despite chips on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction, tables Copland out of the box. Flat as can be, smooth ground. Fence is well made, operates smoothly. Machine is quiet as could be expected. Face of finished lumber is as smooth as glass (going with the grain)
customer_reviews.author: Paul Anderson

customer_reviews.title: This is a really nice machine. The helical cutter head cuts very smooth
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice machine. The helical cutter head cuts very smooth, even more smooth than my 16" Laguna planer with the sheartec head. Adjustments are easy to make, bed is really nice and flat. The motor runs very quiet, and while it's cutting, it doesn't make a lot of noise either. Dust collection is really good as well. Instructions are really good, and it comes with a few extra cutter knives and some push blocks as well. I give it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Serious wood working machine
customer_reviews.text: Powerful smooth Machine. Heavy as heck. You’ll need help setting it up. Crating was damaged but machine was not. This is a serious wood working machine. Very happy to have it in my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Medeiros

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but really high quality well worth it
customer_reviews.text: Came just about ready to use, super high quality, well machined, exception cut quality and adjustments. I now have Powermatic table saw, planer, and lathes.
customer_reviews.author: Simon M

customer_reviews.title: Amazed with this jointer
customer_reviews.text: Amazed with this jointer. Easy to assemble from the two crates. After set up and a thorough cleaning I jointed my 7' boards easily and perfectly, without any adjustments. I jointed 12 boards and all my glue joints are perfect! I've been doing a happy dance ever since!
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Scheetz

customer_reviews.title: Amazon freight problems, but they made it right
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this on December 19, arrived January 11. Keystone Kops logistics to blame, including engaging a shipper that doesn't serve my zip code. But it arrived safe and sound, and the first jointed board (a reclaimed barnwood 2x4) came out beautifully square and smooth. The helical cutter head is quieter than my dust collector. Have completed about half of my first project (a kitchen cart) and this jointer has been amazing. Straight and true, powerful, quiet--what else do you want? Finish is so smooth I doubt I'll fuzz it up by sanding. Need to day it, I guess: Thanks, Powermatic!
customer_reviews.author: Arky Pete

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly difficult to calibrate infeed and outfeed tables.
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and go with the parallel jointer. It is an absolute nightmare to calibrate the infeed and outfeed tables. I've had it for 5 months and have spent dozens of hours trying to get it right and it's still not perfect. And no, it does not always come perfect from factory! Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Far better than my old Delta 8 inch jointer
customer_reviews.text: Far better than my old Delta 8 inch jointer, which I loved. But the helical cutterhead makes cutting less effort and less noise. You don't have to force the board across the table. Machine arrived in a coffin-sized wooden box. Was true right out of the box. Setup required one other person to lift the bed onto the stand. The bed weighs 300 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Torgeson

customer_reviews.title: Great performance and easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the build quality and setup, table alignment was spot on and I was jointing boards in no time. Dust collection with a dust collector works very well. Face jointing 8" rock maple was a piece of cake.
customer_reviews.author: D. Arvay

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT MACHINE! I previously owned a Delta 6" and ...
customer_reviews.text: A GREAT MACHINE! I previously owned a Delta 6" and then a Grizzly 8" jointer. The DELTA was OK, just too small. The Grizzly was maginal; you usually get what you pay for! In all fairness, I finally realized I needed to order the machine with a HELICAL cutterhead. It makes a TREMENDOUS difference in the finished cut! I also bought the mobile base; DON'T waste your money on that: it is NOT stable.
customer_reviews.author: S. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice but has one annoying design flaw. Wood chips come out the front.
customer_reviews.author: Warthawg

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy and impressive remeber it is 240 volts
customer_reviews.text: Needed a lot of calibrating. and for some reason it still cuts concave if you make many passes?
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good jointer. However
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good jointer. However, after a few days of use it became increasingly louder. I finally figured out that the set screw on the pulley was loose. After tightening this, it became quite again. After a few hours it got loud again. Same process all over, tighten the set screw. I eventually went to Lowe's and purchased some new set screws, put locktite on them, and haven't had any issues since. I also recommend spraying some silicon on the surface.
customer_reviews.author: B. Rucker

customer_reviews.title: Great, standard A+ for powermatic
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the A+ standard I was expecting . 3 years strong
customer_reviews.author: Lewis R

product_meta.title: Powermatic 1610086K Model 60HH 8-Inch 2 HP 1-Phase Jointer with Helical Cutterhead
product_meta.description:
Style:Jointer with Helical CutterheadFROM THE MANUFACTURER
This 8-Inch jointer meets the demand for accuracy while combining unique, user-friendly functions. The infeed table lever can be used to rapidly position table height, then the handle rotated for fine-adjustment of cut depth. Fence tilting is accomplished by a worm gear system, smoothly operated by a simple handwheel. The tables provide 73-Inch long extended support. A non-mar insert in the fence protects the table from scratches during adjustments. The jointer is available with a three knife cutterhead, or a helical cutterhead with four-sided knife inserts. The operating switch is high mounted for easy reach, and the push blocks have a magnetic base - store them on any metallic surface for instant access.
feature_bullets: Helical cutterhead with four sided inserts provides smoother, quieter cutting and a superior finish
Extra long tables are mounted on dovetailed ways, for extended workpiece support
Adjustment lever offers quick infeed table positioning and fine tuning of cut depth
Handwheel operated worm gear system for smooth fence tilting
High mount switch for operator convenience. Dust collection minimum - required (CFM) 450

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars33 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
